title: Blueback
author: Tim Winton
metaDescription: Parent curriculum guide for Blueback. See what your child will learn week by week.
outcomes: Identifying and analysing symbolism (Blueback as symbol)
Understanding descriptive language and sense of place
Analysing narrative structure and time shifts
Connecting textual analysis to environmental themes

topics: Introduction to Blueback and Australian coastal context
Understanding Abel's relationship with the ocean

weeks.title: How the Text Works
weeks.description: Discovering how Winton constructs connection to place
topics: Exploring the central pattern: Environmental Connection
Understanding how relationship with nature shapes identity
Analysing how structure mirrors life journey

weeks.title: Analysing Key Techniques
weeks.description: Learning to identify and analyse Winton's techniques
topics: Technique 1: Symbolism (Blueback as connection to nature)
Collecting textual evidence for each technique

weeks.title: Building the Argument
weeks.description: Developing a thesis and analytical argument
topics: Exploring the guiding question: How does Winton use Blueback as a symbol to demonstrate that protecting nature means protecting our connection to place?

weeks.title: Writing the Introduction
topics: Drafting and refining the introduction paragraph

technique.name: Symbolism
technique.description: Blueback symbolizes Abel's deep connection to the ocean and the responsibility to protect what we love.

weeks.title: Body Paragraph 2
topics: Building on analytical skills from Week 6
Exploring how vivid imagery creates sense of place

technique.name: Descriptive Language
technique.description: Winton's rich sensory language immerses readers in the underwater world, creating visceral connection to the ocean environment.
